instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that had liquid contact and has no wifi. It has a burnt L3404, L3401, and some surroundig caps. I don't have any <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B to steal those parts. Can I use those parts from any other board?

TKS

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Actualy, it seams that only L3404 had exploded. However, the pads are gone.

Is there any way to fix this pads? If so, can i use other part from other board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Bypass L3404 with a tiny wire.
Be sure no short on its pad 2 to ground; w/ and w/o airport connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
I don't think i  have a short in <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL>. (OL in diode reading).

Just to be sure, i should jumper L3404 pin 1 to <CAPACITOR>C3422</CAPACITOR> pin 1, correct?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: You should run a wire from <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN_F</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Tks. That's what I've done, I have 5V on  <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL> , but still no wifi. It says no hardware present.
I'm not sure if i had to have continuity from L3401 (pin1) <SIGNAL>PCIE_CLK100M_MINI_CONN_N</SIGNAL> to <CAPACITOR>C3422</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL>, but i don't have it.
Can it be <CHIP>U3402</CHIP> (I have 3.3V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>)? How can i check it?
What should I check now. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: Post <SIGNAL>MINI_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCIE_MINI_PRSNT_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>MINI_CLKEWQ_L</SIGNAL> levels.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Just realized that the wire that i've jumped has "exploded" / breaked after a few reboots.
It seams that i have a short on the airport. With the  airport cable connected, i get 0.002 in diode readings, and 0.5 ohm to ground on  <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL> . Can i check anything else?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Airport card, or cable.
Disconnect airport card on the other side of the cable.
See where the short remains.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
I'm sorry. I've write the wrong model. It is an 1286 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B model. 
The cable goes right to the interior of the display. Is there a card inside?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: Yes, under the black round plastic cover...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Tks. Didn't know that.
The cable was presured by a screw. After disassembling it, the short has gone.
Now I have 5V on <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL> and 0.504 in diode mode, and 50kohm to ground, but no wifi yet.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: Damaged cable, I suppose...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>MINI_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PCIE_MINI_PRSNT_L</SIGNAL>  = 0.001

<SIGNAL>MINI_CLKEWQ_L</SIGNAL> i can't find...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: Sorry for the typo; read <SIGNAL>MINI_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> instead.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: <SIGNAL>MINI_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>  = 3,397V w/o airport conected. With airport conected, i get 0.024V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Values look good.
Try connecting the airport from another LCD assembly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Hi,
Today, i managed to find a display (with the wifi) for this model, and when i was trying it, the mac doesn't power on.
I have a missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> voltage. I look at L3405 (the jumper was near to it)  and it seams ok, and can't find any missing components..
Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: Does it turn on without LCD (no airport)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Hi, no it doesn't. However, I saw that <CAPACITOR>C2511</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C2581</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C2580</CAPACITOR> were knocked out.

Because i have no other <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board, I've replaced them for 2x 16V X7R 100nF +- 10% caps (<CAPACITOR>C2511</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C2581</CAPACITOR>) and one 10V XR5 470nF +-10% (<CAPACITOR>C2580</CAPACITOR>) cap. Not sure if they are compatible. Are they?

Stil dosen't power on.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Do you get correct L7770 voltage?
Remember, this board doesn't start until press the power button.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Sorry. You're right (as always...).
It was the power button.
TKS!
